Posts.EditableText: I was looking in the announcement section and the game library for any games created with Squiffy and I can only locate 1, which is well done and uses google maps. I was just trying to see some examples of finished products. Anyone know of any?
Posts.HTML: I was looking in the announcement section and the game library for any games created with Squiffy and I can only locate 1, which is well done and uses google maps. I was just trying to see some examples of finished products. Anyone know of any?

Posts.EditableText: The Squiffy games I've written and seen are labeled html games on their main page. Squiffy is never mentioned.
Posts.HTML: The Squiffy games I've written and seen are labeled html games on their main page. Squiffy is never mentioned.

Posts.EditableText:
That's correct, as far as this site "knows", a Squiffy game is just an HTML game.

You can usually tell a Squiffy game because it will have a similar look to others, with a Restart link at the top right. Also, if you view the HTML source in your browser, there is a comment at the top that tells you the game was created with Squiffy.
Posts.HTML:
That's correct, as far as this site "knows", a Squiffy game is just an HTML game.

You can usually tell a Squiffy game because it will have a similar look to others, with a Restart link at the top right. Also, if you view the HTML source in your browser, there is a comment at the top that tells you the game was created with Squiffy.

Posts.EditableText: ah ok, thanks for the response. I wish there was a filter to aid in finding them like the different genres. The majority seem to be Quest, but I do remember seeing the HTML games. Thank you all
